title: ethminer can't find mining work in geth's rpc(8545)
body:
state:
     start geth： nohup geth --datadir data --http --http.addr 0.0.0.0 --http.api eth --miner.etherbase  ****** & > nohup.out
     start ethminer:    nohup ./ethminer -v 9 -U -P http://127.0.0.1:8545 & > nohup.out

question:
     ethminer log print:
          `ethminer 0.18.0
Build: linux/release/gnu

 i 09:26:21 ethminer Configured pool 127.0.0.1:8545
 i 09:26:21 ethminer Selected pool 127.0.0.1:8545
 i 09:26:21 ethminer Established connection to 127.0.0.1:8545
 i 09:26:21 ethminer Spinning up miners...
 i 09:26:21 ethminer  >> {"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0","method":"eth_getWork","params":[]}
cu 09:26:21 cuda-0   Using Pci Id : 01:00.0 NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090 (Compute 8.6) Memory : 23.70 GB
 i 09:26:21 ethminer  << {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"no mining work available yet"}}
 X 09:26:21 ethminer Got code:-32000 message:no mining work available yet  from 127.0.0.1:8545
`

You node just started and nothing is passed as the sealing task. So no mining work generated yet.
You can wait a bit and confirm that your node is synced.
ou....geth has been synced to the latest block of the chain.I started ethminer after the sync is complete
I've tried turning it enable, but geth doesn't start mining. It is worth mentioning here that ethming outputs "SIGSEGV encountered".
Could you post some logs from Geth side?

It seems that there is a sealing task, but when I use the nvidia-smi command to check the status of the graphics card, there is no graphics card in use
I found out today that it seems to be a CUDA version problem, I am recompiling the 86 version because my CUDA is the latest 11.7
